alert.note: Alert for Phillips; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 04 at 8:59PM CDT until July 05 at 12:30AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM CDT WEDNESDAY FOR SOUTHEASTERN PHILLIPS AND SOUTHWESTERN SMITH COUNTIES... At 859 PM CDT, trained weather spotters reported flash flooding along Highway 9 between Cedar and Kirwin. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Kirwin and Cedar. This includes the following streams and drainages... Cedar Creek, Beaver Creek, North Fork Solomon River, Crooked Creek, Bow Creek, Kirwin Reservoir Area, Medicine Creek, Plum Creek, Deer Creek, Turner Creek, and Glen Rock Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
